description: Smallest prime that is the sum of n consecutive composite numbers.
example: a(4) = 97 because 22 + 24 + 25 + 26 = 97 and it is the least such prime.
mathematica: f[n_Integer] := Block[ {k = n + PrimePi[n] + 1}, While[ k - PrimePi[k] - 1 != n, k++ ]; k]; Do[c = Table[ f[k], {k, 1, n} ]; k = n + 1; While[ p = Apply[ Plus, c]; ! PrimeQ[p], c = Delete[c, 1]; c = Append[ c, f[k] ]; k++ ]; Print[p], {n, 2, 60} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 22 2001
